    ����� ˵��
    com.slytechs.library  
    org.jnetpcap
    Core libpcap functionality available on all platforms.
    org.jnetpcap.nio
    Native memory and IO management classes.
    org.jnetpcap.winpcap
    WinPcap extensions to libpcap avialable on a limited set of platforms.

    • org.jnetpcap��LibraryMember��ʹ��

      ע������ΪLibraryMember��org.jnetpcap�еķ��� 
      �޶��������� ������˵��
      int Pcap.activate()
      Is used to activate a packet capture handle to look at packets on the network, with the options that were set on the handle being in effect.
      void Pcap.breakloop()
      set a flag that will force pcap_dispatch() or pcap_loop() to return rather than looping.
      int Pcap.canSetRfmon()
      Check whether monitor mode can be set for a not-yet-activated capture handle.
      void Pcap.close()
      pcap_close() closes the files associated with p and deallocates resources.
      int Pcap.compile(PcapBpfProgram program, java.lang.String str, int optimize, int netmask)
      Compile a packet filter, converting a high level filtering expression in to a progra that can be interpreted by the kernel-level filtering engine.
      static int Pcap.compileNoPcap(int snaplen, int dlt, PcapBpfProgram program, java.lang.String str, int optimize, int netmask)
      Compile a packet filter without the need of opening an adapter.
      static Pcap Pcap.create(java.lang.String device, java.lang.StringBuilder errbuf)
      pcap_create() is used to create a packet capture handle to look at packets on the network. source is a string that specifies the network device to open; on Linux systems with 2.2 or later kernels, a source argument of "any" or NULL can be used to capture packets from all interfaces.
      int Pcap.datalink()
      Returns the link layer of an adapter.
      static int Pcap.datalinkNameToVal(java.lang.String name)
      Translates a data link type name, which is a DLT_ name with the DLT_ removed, to the corresponding data link type value.
      static java.lang.String Pcap.datalinkValToDescription(int dlt)
      Translates a data link type value to a short description of that data link type.
      static java.lang.String Pcap.datalinkValToName(int dlt)
      Translates a data link type value to the corresponding data link type name.
      PcapDumper Pcap.dumpOpen(java.lang.String fname)
      Open a file to write packets.
      static int Pcap.findAllDevs(java.util.List<PcapIf> alldevs, java.lang.StringBuilder errbuf)
      pcap_findalldevs() constructs a list of network devices that can be opened with pcap_open_live().
      static void Pcap.freecode(PcapBpfProgram program)
      This frees up the code structures, but does not released the peered base bpf_program peer structure.
      java.lang.String Pcap.getErr()
      return the error text pertaining to the last pcap library error.
      int Pcap.getNonBlock(java.lang.StringBuilder errbuf)
      pcap_getnonblock() returns the current ``non-blocking'' state of the capture descriptor; it always returns 0 on ``savefiles''.
      int Pcap.inject(JBuffer buf, int start, int len)
      Private method to perform work.
      private int Pcap.injectPrivate(java.nio.ByteBuffer buf, int start, int len)
      Private method to perform work.
      static boolean Pcap.isInjectSupported()
      Checks if the current platform has support for pcap_inject call.
      static boolean Pcap.isSendPacketSupported()
      Checks if the current platform has support for pcap_sendpacket call.
      int Pcap.isSwapped()
      returns true if the current savefile uses a different byte order than the current system.
      static java.lang.String Pcap.libVersion()
      Returns a pointer to a string giving information about the version of the libpcap library being used; note that it contains more information than just a version number.
      static java.lang.String Pcap.lookupDev(java.lang.StringBuilder errbuf)
      Returns a network device suitable for use with openLive and lookupNet.
      static int Pcap.lookupNet(java.lang.String device, JNumber netp, JNumber maskp, java.lang.StringBuilder errbuf)
      Determines the network number and mask associated with the network device.
      static int Pcap.lookupNet(java.lang.String device, PcapInteger netp, PcapInteger maskp, java.lang.StringBuilder errbuf)
      �ѹ�ʱ�� 
      use of PcapInteger has been deprecated
      private <T> int Pcap.loop(int cnt, ByteBufferHandler<T> handler, T user, PcapHeader header)
      Loop.

      Private native implementation.
      private <T> int Pcap.loop(int cnt, int id, PcapPacketHandler<T> handler, T user, JPacket packet, JPacket.State state, PcapHeader header, JScanner scanner)
      Private native implementation.
      private <T> int Pcap.loop(int cnt, JBufferHandler<T> handler, T user, PcapHeader header, JBuffer buffer)
      Loop.
      int Pcap.loop(int cnt, PcapDumper dumper)
      A specialized loop method that utilizes a fast native dumper without entering java environment.
      <T> int Pcap.loop(int cnt, PcapHandler<T> handler, T user)
      �ѹ�ʱ�� 
      use of PcapHandler has been replaced with ByteBufferHandler
      int Pcap.majorVersion()
      Return the major version number of the pcap library used to write the savefile.
      int Pcap.minorVersion()
      Return the minor version number of the pcap library used to write the savefile.
      JBuffer Pcap.next(PcapHeader pkt_header, JBuffer buffer)
      Return the next available packet. pcap_next() reads the next packet (by calling pcap_dispatch() with a cnt of 1) and returns a u_char pointer to the data in that packet.
      java.nio.ByteBuffer Pcap.next(PcapPktHdr pkt_header)
      �ѹ�ʱ�� 
      use of PcapPktHdr has been replaced with PcapHeader
      int Pcap.nextEx(PcapHeader pkt_header, JBuffer buffer)
      Read a packet from an interface or from an offline capture.
      static Pcap Pcap.openDead(int linktype, int snaplen)
      Create a pcap_t structure without starting a capture. pcap_open_dead() is used for creating a pcap_t structure to use when calling the other functions in libpcap.
      static Pcap Pcap.openLive(java.lang.String device, int snaplen, int promisc, int timeout, java.lang.StringBuilder errbuf)
      Open a live capture associated with the specified network interface device. pcap_open_live() is used to obtain a packet capture descriptor to look at packets on the network. device is a string that specifies the network device to open; on Linux systems with 2.2 or later kernels, a device argument of "any" or NULL can be used to capture packets from all interfaces. snaplen specifies the maximum number of bytes to capture.
      static Pcap Pcap.openOffline(java.lang.String fname, java.lang.StringBuilder errbuf)
      Open a savefile in the tcpdump/libpcap format to read packets.
      int Pcap.sendPacket(JBuffer buf)
      This method allows to send a raw packet to the network.
      int Pcap.setBufferSize(long size)
      sets the buffer size that will be used on a capture handle when the handle is activated to buffer_size, which is in units of bytes.
      int Pcap.setDatalink(int dlt)
      Set the current data link type of the pcap descriptor to the type specified by dlt.
      int Pcap.setDirection(int dir)
      Set the direction for which packets will be captured.
      int Pcap.setFilter(PcapBpfProgram program)
      Associate a filter to a capture. pcap_setfilter() is used to specify a filter program. fp is a pointer to a bpf_program struct, usually the result of a call to Pcap.compile(PcapBpfProgram, String, int, int)
      int Pcap.setNonBlock(int nonBlock, java.lang.StringBuilder errbuf)
      pcap_setnonblock() puts a capture descriptor, opened with pcap_open_live(), into ``non-blocking'' mode, or takes it out of ``non-blocking'' mode, depending on whether the nonblock argument is non-zero or zero.
      int Pcap.setPromisc(int promisc)
      Set promiscuous mode for a not-yet-activated capture handle.
      int Pcap.setRfmon(int rfmon)
      Set monitor mode for a not-yet-activated capture handle.
      int Pcap.setSnaplen(int snaplen)
      Set the snapshot length for a not-yet-activated capture handle.
      int Pcap.setTimeout(int timeout)
      Set the read timeout for a not-yet-activated capture handle.
      int Pcap.snapshot()
      Return the dimension of the packet portion (in bytes) that is delivered to the application. pcap_snapshot() returns the snapshot length specified when pcap_open_live was called.
      int Pcap.stats(PcapStat stats)
      Returns statistics on the current capture.

      static int WinPcap.findAllDevsEx(java.lang.String source, WinPcapRmtAuth auth, java.util.List<PcapIf> alldevs, java.lang.StringBuffer errbuf)

      int WinPcap.liveDump(java.lang.String fname, int maxsize, int maxpackets)
      dumps the network traffic from an interface to a file.
      int WinPcap.liveDumpEnded(int sync)
      Return the status of the kernel dump process, i.e. tells if one of the limits defined with pcap_live_dump() has been reached.
      static int WinPcap.offlineFilter(PcapBpfProgram program, int caplen, int len, java.nio.ByteBuffer buf)

      replaced by WinPcap.offlineFilter(PcapBpfProgram, PcapHeader, JBuffer)
      static WinPcap WinPcap.open(java.lang.String source, int snaplen, int flags, int timeout, WinPcapRmtAuth auth, java.lang.StringBuffer errbuf)
      Open a generic source in order to capture/send (WinPcap only) traffic.
      static WinPcap WinPcap.openDead(int linktype, int snaplen)
      Create a pcap_t structure without starting a capture. pcap_open_dead() is used for creating a pcap_t structure to use when calling the other functions in libpcap.
      static WinPcap WinPcap.openLive(java.lang.String device, int snaplen, int promisc, int timeout, java.lang.StringBuffer errbuf)
      This method, overrides the generic libpcap based openLive method, and allocates a peer pcap object that allows WinPcap extensions.
      static WinPcap WinPcap.openOffline(java.lang.String fname, java.lang.StringBuffer errbuf)
      Open a savefile in the tcpdump/libpcap format to read packets.
      int WinPcap.sendQueueTransmit(WinPcapSendQueue queue, int synch)
      Send a queue of raw packets to the network.
      int WinPcap.setBuff(int dim)
      Set the size of the kernel buffer associated with an adapter.
      int WinPcap.setMinToCopy(int size)
      Set the minumum amount of data received by the kernel in a single call.
      int WinPcap.setMode(int mode)
      Set the working mode of the interface p to mode.
      WinPcapSamp WinPcap.setSampling()
      Define a sampling method for packet capture.
      WinPcapStat WinPcap.statsEx()
      This method extends the Pcap.stats method and allows more statistics to be returned.
